messages.message:
@Serena thank you. I confirm we're talking about the AI Hub

1. The discrepancies they noticed is that their YAML file did not reference the possibility to add custom keys in the body of the [POST] RUN deployment endpoint.
2. Here another example from the partner: "_the "files" endpoint keep disappearing one after another in the API documentation. As of today I can only see the [GET] read file endpoint (https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/files/read-file) Although the Yaml file still references the PUT and HEAD an DELETE methods...A few days ago, these methods were still in a section of the API doc._
      _So here lies my questions:_
• _if these methods are still supported, why are they deleted from the official API doc? Even if they are flagged as [DEPRECATED] they should be document if they exist, shouldn't they?_
       _This give me the impression that the PUT HEAD and DELETE file methods will be silently shut down without prior notice    as I have experienced similar cases previously with Instabase: is this true? If so, deleting the file endpoints could lead to issues for my technical integrations so I would be glad if we can sort this out"_ 
_@subbu_

@Chris Cowell the file operations are missing in the docs, we added writeFile and deleteFile - I remember seeing writefile in the docs
Can you check why it went missing
I remember HEAD wasn’t showing up but the other 3 were there
Not sure why the other operations aren’t showing up under “Files”. They should be. I’m investigating.

There was a glitch with the last docs deploy, and the 25.30 docs were deployed with an old version of the API spec, which is why those Files-related operations unintentionally vanished. I’m working on re-deploying to prod now with the operations restored.

UPDATE: The production docs at `docs.instabase.com (http://docs.instabase.com)` now have 3 of the 4 file-related operations restored. We’ll adjust the docs workflow to prevent future regressions (the problem was related to git submodules).

The fourth file-related operation--which uses the `HEAD` verb--can’t be displayed by our third-party docs tool Fern, but I’ve submitted a feature request to handle those operations.

@Lucile I’m a little confused by the customer complaint about the YAML not mentioning custom keys when running an app. I see a reference to that feature in the production docs at https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/runs/run-app
@Lucile Happy to work with you and the customer more if there are things we can clarify or highlight in the docs, to prevent confusion. Just let me know how I can help.
@Lucile will you please express the docs team’s thanks to the customer for helping us to identify the issue with our deployment as part of this? :pray:
